meanings.definition: To make reflective or capable of reflecting light.
meanings.sent1: I reflectorize my bike helmet for safety when riding at night.
meanings.sent2: The workers reflectorize the road signs to make them more visible in the dark.
meanings.sent3: I tried to reflectorize my shoes, but now they shine so bright, I can't look at them!
meanings.sent4: Her smile reflectorizes the room, brightening up everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The moon reflectorizes the calm lake, creating a beautiful shimmering effect.

meanings.definition: To apply reflective material to an object.
meanings.sent1: I need to reflectorize my backpack before going on a hike.
meanings.sent2: The workers reflectorize the traffic cones for better visibility on the road.
meanings.sent3: I reflectorize my umbrella, so I can easily spot it in a crowd.
meanings.sent4: The artist reflectorizes the sculpture, making it stand out in the gallery.
meanings.sent5: The sun reflectorizes the skyscraper, making it gleam like a diamond.
